item.title: Sony Crashes PlayStation Portal Pricing in a Sudden Clearance Push, Making Remote PS5 Gaming Cheaper Overnight
item.content:encoded:
PlayStation Portal Remote Players are great for streaming your favorite titles directly from your console over Wi-Fi, without relying on a bigger screen. These are great for gaming anywhere you want, from the comfort of your cozy bed to the lounge, or even away from home. On a regular day, you‚Äôd pay around $200 to snap one, but that changes today.

Amazon is currently offering the PlayStation Portal Remote Player for just $179, after taking 10% off its usual price. The offer applies to both white and black models, but there‚Äôs a catch. The discount is only available today, as it wraps up at midnight. If you‚Äôve been thinking of picking one, now is the time to act. Just note that these are likely going to be shipped after Christmas. If you‚Äôre looking to gift it to a loved one, it‚Äôs important to keep this timeline in mind and plan accordingly.

See at Amazon

Remote Access

The remote player comes with a nice 8-inch LCD, Full HD screen that pushes vibrant, detailed visuals for all your favorite titles. This thing is capable of delivering smooth gameplay at up to 60fps with exceptional image clarity on its 1080p resolution screen for an immersive experience. These visuals are thoughtfully paired with the Tempest 3D AudioTech for better sound. Connecting a compatible audio device, either wirelessly via PlayStation Link or wired via the 3.5mm audio jack, gets you that realistic, room-filling audio that pulls you into action. Adaptive triggers and haptic feedback take the experience a bit further by creating sensations that actually make you feel like a part of the digital world.

Portal Remote Player requires broadband internet Wi-Fi to stream the compatible games installed on your PS5 console. Your Wi-Fi should have at least 5Mbps speeds to get started, but a high-speed connection of at least 15Mbps will give you a smooth gaming experience. Getting started couldn‚Äôt be simpler. All you need to do is connect the console the a broadband internet connection, and turn it on in Rest Mode. Ensure Remote Play is enabled in Settings > System > Remote Play. Then, power your portal on, log into your PSN account, and choose the pairing option. You can also tap your console from the home screen to establish a connection.

Note that titles that require a VR headset or additional peripherals (except DualShock 4, DualSense, or DualSense Edge wireless controller) won‚Äôt work with the player. PS Plus Premium membership is supported, but only for the games that are installed on your console. The membership gets you instant access to hundreds of games from the Game Catalog and Classics Catalog. New titles are added every month, so you‚Äôll never be out of worlds to explore.

Taking everything into consideration, those who have been looking to enjoy their favorite titles remotely can benefit from having the PlayStation Portal Remote Player in their setup. It normally runs for $200, but you can now snap it up for $179. Both white and black versions are discounted, so there are options to choose from. Remember, the offer ends at midnight, so you only have a few more hours left to save. Grab it as fast as you can to avoid last-minute rush and chaos.
